pageTitle: Itinerary for Friday, March 22, 2019 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Woodbridge, Ontario

10:00 a.m. The Prime Minister and Minister of Employment, Workforce Development and Labour Patty Hajdu will visit the College of Carpenters and Allied Trades to highlight Budget 2019’s Canada Training Benefit.

College of Carpenters and Allied Trades
420 Rowntree Dairy Road

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity
  • Media are asked to arrive no later than 9:15 a.m.

Thunder Bay, Ontario

2:30 p.m. The Prime Minister and Minister of Employment, Workforce Development and Labour Patty Hajdu will visit LiUNA Local 607, and make a skills and training announcement to highlight Budget 2019’s Canada Training Benefit. A media availability will follow.

LiUNA Local 607
730 Balmoral Street

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage for remarks
  • Media are asked to arrive no later than 1:45 p.m.

7:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a town hall Q&A.

C.J. Sanders Fieldhouse
Lakehead University
983 Oliver Road

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media requiring parking for satellite trucks should contact media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca
  • Media requiring advance setup will have access to the site as of 5:30 p.m., and are asked to present themselves to the gymnasium doors marked “Media Entrance.” All media should arrive no later than 6:30 p.m.
